application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T1 Oak, Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by up to 2m and remove deadwood. to maintain size and shape
decision_conditions: Where there is deadwood with in the canopy of the tree, there is no requirement to gain permission to remove it, but this is covered as a notification that work is intended to remove deadwood from the Oak tree.
It is recommended that this Oak tree T2 as shown on the Havering TPO plan 41/73 can be overall crown reduced by up to 2m from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the tree balanced.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The applicant is advised that if you wish to carry out further works to the above tree[s] you will need to obtain our further consent.
